item.content:encoded:
This communication campaign focused on the problem of Heteronormativity in Vietnam. I and Ly had the chance to take on the art direction for the campaign. Following on the topic of Heteronormativity, we actually found out about this Heteronormative Design Discourse on Design Observer, which was kinda relevant and inspired us to dig further into the discussion.

It addresses the often-overlooked matter of sexual identity within the design world and emphasizes the enduring prevalence of heteronormative assumptions in both design practice and discourse. The infrequent use of the term “heteronormative” in design discussions perpetuates a cultural norm that prioritizes heteronormative values and perspectives.

What we focused on were: unorthodox, marginalized, overlooked, underrepresented, non-canon, and radical.

Here are my motion graphic designs for the campaign. The typography revolved around the shapes and silhouettes of everyday objects in Vietnam, such as plastic stools or household stand fans.

  • Bảo Anh as co-art director, motion/graphic designer
  • Diệu Ly as co-art director and graphic designer
  • Chú An, Nguyen Nguyen, Tram Nguyen and Tú Bông for graphic design and illustration
  • Chị Bẩu, Nguyen Le Thuy Linh, and Phuong Luong for content copy and campaign planning
  • This work is under Vietnamme organization

item.content:encoded:
Singapore Design Week 2023 featured a symposium curated by renowned curator Paola Antonelli. The event delved into the future of design and ‘design of the future,’ gathering influential minds from Singapore and around the world.

The core theme, ‘Design as an enzyme for progress,’ envisioned the future of design as if viewed through a microscope, drawing parallels with the processes of fermentation, synthesis, and mutation.

The identity design embraced the metaphorical microscope, revealing a captivating cellular motif. My role was to create motion graphics that complemented this identity.

On top of crafting static animated clips, I also had to design some customizable After Effects templates for title screen and lowerthirds. These templates allowed others to easily edit the text and modify the layout according to their needs.

  • Bảo Anh as motion graphic designer
  • Fabio Maragno as graphic designer
  • Randy Yeo as design director
  • Joey Lim as project manager
  • Works are done at studio Practice Theory

item.content:encoded:
This is an entry for the Google Development Solution Challenge, which involves UI/UX design and visual development for a smartphone app designed to facilitate the buying and selling of used goods.

The app is tailored specifically for students and residents of the Vietnamese National University village, where most of the team’s member live. Given that many college students in this area have limited expenditure and rely on the second-hand & giveaway economy, the app aims to provide a convenient mobile platform for their needs, ranging from clothes, books to more valuable items like household appliances or motorbikes.

The visual identity of this app is designed to exude a youthful and fresh vibe, as it is primarily targeted at a younger audience, specifically college students.

Because the app’s functionality is akin to those e-commerce app on the market like Shopee or Carousell in Singapore, we followed along the line to devise the UI design for the app.

  • Bảo Anh as UI/UX designer, mascot illustrator, co-brand design director and motion designer
  • Diệu Ly as UI/UX designer, and co-brand design director
  • Sesẻ team at VNU-UIT Google Developer Student Club for app development and UI/UX design

item.content:encoded:
While streaks are designed to motivate Duolingo’s users to come back to their lessons, they have slowly lost their novelty and appeal. Once learners fall off a long streak, they lose their motivation to learn again. Since NFT has been the hottest thing in mainstream culture for 29.7% of Gen-Zers, owning an NFT is owning the ultimate bragging material.

Our solution: We gave them a solution to immortalize their streaks and showcase it in an even cooler way. By recording our users’ learning data, we’re generating a unique NFT for everyone. Upon being minted onto our eco-friendly blockchain, these NFTs will store users’ streaks and can be updated as they progress through their learning journey. Users can share their NFT onto social media in whatever way they want for the ultimate brag.

The illustration direction for the NFTs is pixel art combined with isometric/trimetric perspective drawing. The rest of of the art directions follows the Duolingo visual identity like Feather Green colour or the DIN Next Rounded typography.

The final promotional video is the toughest part of this execution phase. I had to finish it from start to end within 1 week before the submission deadline.

  • Bảo Anh as motion/animation designer and character illustrator
  • Diệu Ly as graphic designer and animation support
  • Hà Đàm as copywriter
  • Duy Nguyễn as copywriter
  • Farida Kbar and Thanh Ngo for consultation
  • (Personally thanks to The Lab Saigon for these valuable experiences working with NFT projects)
  • This entry joined the competition under Hà and Duy’s college – RMIT University Vietnam
